result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas L Helton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Elderly [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Obtain fulltime employment or schooling or a combination of both for fulltime.
No contact with Donna Helton unless she agrees and agent approves.

Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and DOC.
Provide a DNA sample if not already provided. 
Sign all releases of information as requested by the agent. 
If he successfully completes probation and if the agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Douglas L Helton
Current: 400 N Division Street, c/o Homeless Connections, Appleton, WI 54911 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2015)
Prior: General Delivery, Appleton, WI 54911 United States

Defendant Douglas L Helton in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:15 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years:
No contact with Donna Helton unless she agrees and agent approves.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and DOC.
Obtain fulltime employment or schooling or a combination of both for fulltime.
Provide a DNA sample if not already provided. 
Pay costs and the DNA surcharge. 
Sign all releases of information as requested by the agent. 
If he successfully completes probation and if the agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.
Sentencing hearing on June 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Douglas L Helton in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:02 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered and due by June 3, 2015
Reports to be distributed accordingly
Bond and conditions of bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Douglas L Helton in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Douglas L Helton in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler (Atty Drury present today)  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Ryan W. Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Douglas L Helton appeared by video. 
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
(Signature bond refused to sign)
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel Atty Drengler

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Donna Helton  *Unless a written request from the victim and a Family Safety Plan is filed with the District Attorney and the Clerk of Courts.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Battery (Domestic).
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
